div.documentation: Configures the declaritive role based security without EJB, which uses the Acegi Security System for Spring.

a.title: Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'ROLE_'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'org.acegisecurity.vote.AffirmativeBased'
Optional, defaults to 'org.acegisecurity.vote.RoleVoter'
Optional, defaults to 'false'
Optional, defaults to 'org.acegisecurity.intercept.method.aopalliance.MethodSecurityInterceptor'

Optional, no default value available

Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'UIL2ConnectionFactory'
Optional, defaults to '{0}JmsTemplate'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'true'
Optional, defaults to 'org.jnp.interfaces.NamingContextFactory'
Optional, defaults to 'org.springframework.jms.listener.adapter.MessageListenerAdapter'
Optional, defaults to 'org.springframework.jms.listener.DefaultMessageListenerContainer'
Optional, defaults to 'JBossMQ'
Optional, defaults to 'localhost:1099'
Optional, defaults to 'queue/'
Optional, defaults to '30000'
Optional, defaults to 'org.springframework.jms.core.JmsTemplate'
Optional, defaults to 'topic/'
Optional, defaults to 'org.jnp.interfaces:org.jboss.naming'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext.xml'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext-import-remoteServices.xml'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext-dataSource.xml'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext-localDataSource.xml'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext-localEjb.xml'
Optional, defaults to 'applicationContext-manageable.xml'

Optional, defaults to 'beanRefFactory.xml'

Optional, defaults to 'ClientExceptionHandlingAdvice'
Optional, defaults to 'off'

div.documentation: Configures code generation when developing in a Rich Client environment.

a.title: Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, defaults to 'daoAuthenticationProvider'
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available
Optional, no default value available

Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: When using the CRUD feature (manageable entities) this outlet will be used to emit the value objects to (returned by the services to the client).

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which search criteria classes are being generated. If you do not specify this outlet criteria classes will be generated to the daos outlet.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which all service implementation classes will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which all service interfaces and common API classes such as default service exceptions will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAOs, and any support classes.
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAO implementation classes will be generated (if there are any classifier scoped business operations modeled on any entity).
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will be generated to the daos outlet when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which the Spring applicationContext.xml will be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which the AndroMDA OpenSessionInViewFilter will be generated (allows the Hibernate open-session-in-view pattern when you want to expose your enties directly to your presentation tier - allows lazy-loading to occur that level).

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The outlet to which EJB support is generated. If undefined, EJB support will not be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which any advice implementation classes will be generated. Currently this is useful when using the cartridge's remoting support.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where client side code is generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where client side configuration files are generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where client side test implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where server side code is generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where server side implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where server side configuration code is generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where server side test implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where server side test configuration files will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location where AndroMDA merge mapping stub files should be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The pattern to use when constructing the call to the attachment handler (used for sending outgoing attachments when your service also represents a web service), for example:
Axis: org.andromda.webservice.AxisAttachmentHandler.saveAttachment(content, contentType, dime)
Attachments are good for sending large amounts of data over over the wire as it doesn't embed the data directly in the XML. NOTE: the handler call must have three parameters named content, contentType and dime.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The pattern to use when constructing the call to the attachment handler (used for retrieving incoming attachments when your service also represents a web service), for example:
Axis: org.andromda.webservice.AxisAttachmentHandler.getAttachments()
Attachments are good for sending large amounts of data over over the wire as it doesn't embed the data directly in the XML.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the DAOs should make up an inheritance tree in the same way as their respective entities. This is enabled by default but you might want to disable it if you prefer not to have top-level DAO operations visible in child DAO classes, this is usually the case when using JDK5 generics, which can be enabled using the enableTemplating namespace property.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the create methods on the DAOs taking properties from the entity shall be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The path of the file representing the message bundle.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean that stores the message source.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Dao all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Dao".

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the base DAO's name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoBase all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoBase".

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO's implementation name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoImpl all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoImpl".

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to enable Spring transaction support when EJBs are enabled. If this is set to false then only EJB transaction support is generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not EJB transactions should be enabled. This is sometimes useful to turn off when you're using EJB wrapped spring services but want to turn off EJB transaction management so that Spring alone handles the transactions (note that this property only make sense when EJBs are enabled).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Full class name for proxy factory bean used in application context for remote EJB access applicationContextRemoteEjb.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Full class name for proxy factory bean used in application context for local EJB access applicationContextLocalEjb.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The provider URL for remote EJB access.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The initial context factory class for remote EJB access.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The URL package prefixes for remote EJB access.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the pattern to be used when constructing the EJB package name (this allows a Spring Service to be wrapped by a Session EJB and avoids name conflicts). The {0} character represents the service package name. This could be something like {0}.ejb which would create the Spring Session EJBs in the package ending in the ejb package.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when defaultServiceExceptions is true.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Sets a list of default additional interceptors to be applied to service ProxyBeanFactory declarations. They will be listed after the serviceSecurityInterceptor, serviceTransactionInterceptor and hibernateInterceptor if present.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: If this is present, it will be assumed that an external principal store class will be used and non will be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: If externalPrincipalStoreClass is defined, externalPrincipalStoreGetter defines the method call on that class that will retrieve the principal.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: If externalPrincipalStoreClass is defined, externalPrincipalStoreGetterType defines the type returned by the externalPrincipalStoreGetter method.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default transaction type used for service operations (when not wrapping your services with EJBs). NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.spring.transaction.type tagged value.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default transaction type definition used if EJB service operations.
Permitted values are:
NotSupported
Supports
Required
RequiresNew
Mandatory
Never

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group
Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Name of session bean local base interface for ejb wrapper.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Name of session bean remote base interface for ejb wrapper.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Full name of session bean base class for ejb wrapper.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: JDBC Driver to make a database connection.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user login name.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user password.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the Spring application context file.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the Spring CRUD application context file.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the Spring datasource application context file

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the Spring local datasource application context file

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the server side Spring configuration file used to export services for remote invocation.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name given to the client side Spring configuration file used to import services invoked remotely.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType='remote' or 'both') via remote ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-remoteejb.xml).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType='local' or 'both') via local ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-localejb.xml)

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name/path of the bean ref factory resource file (i.e. some/path/beanRefFactory.xml)

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The ID for the Spring bean reference factory (used to load the bean factory).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The ID for the Spring bean reference factory that holds the EJB references.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not a data source will be defined. By default the data source configuration is always generated, however if this is set to false and no entities have been modeled, a data source will not be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring for the local datasource (applicationContextLocalDataSource).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The (JNDI-) user transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The (JNDI-) transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Factory bean that creates a local Hibernate SessionFactory instance within Spring.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. ServiceLocator).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The package to which extra presentation types are generated (i.e. OpenSessionInViewFilter).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the service locator class.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default beanReafFactoryId to be used in the ServiceLocator. By default the beanRefFactoryId is used (if EJB is not activated). If EJB is activated the beanRefFactoryEjbId is used. With the serviceLocatorDefaultFactoryId this behaviour can be explicit overridden.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the CRUD service locator class.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give the service locator class used by remote clients.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether the client service locator should switch the thread context class loader during retrieval of the client application context xml file.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name for the client side exception handling advice

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The base name for the hibernate criteria search utility classes.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the principal store class.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the OpenSessionInViewFilter (when using the open-session-in-view pattern).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the security realm (i.e. animal-quiz, other, etc). NOTE:This enables EJB security if specified.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JNDI data source for data access.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JDBC data source for data access.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the method to use for destroying the JDBC datasource.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not parameters should be checked if they're required (on DAOs and services)

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The encoding for xml documents

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The suffix to append to the names of generated value objects used in CRUD (manageable entities).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The provider URL for remote JMS access (if you're using ActiveMQ as your provider, you'll typically want to set the URL as 'tcp://localhost:61616'; changing the port as necessary of course).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The initial context factory class for JMS access.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The URL package prefixes for remote JMS access.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The default JMS queue connection factory.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the JMS related services (i.e. Queues).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix for topics names (i.e. a prefix of "topic/" would result in a topic named "Events" as "topic/Events"). Applies to the JNDI name (in case of JBossMQ), or physical name (in case of ActiveMQ).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix for queue names (i.e. a prefix of "queue/" would result in a topic named "Events" as "queue/Events"). Applies to the JNDI name (in case of JBossMQ), or physical name (in case of ActiveMQ).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation to use for the Spring JmsTemplate. org.springframework.jms.core.JmsTemplate102 is used for JMS 1.0.2 providers and org.springframework.jms.core.JmsTemplate is used for 1.1 providers.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The timeout at which the transmission of the JMS message will timeout.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern used to create the JMS template used for accessing a destination (topic/queue).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The JMS provider implementation (valid values are "JBossMQ" and "ActiveMQ")

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The Spring message listener adaptor implementation. See API docs.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The Spring message listener container implementation. See API docs.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: If "true", then the values of deliveryMode, priority, and timeToLive will be used when sending a message.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: Set the client identifier base name for JMS connections.

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not subscriptions should be durable by default. Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain).

a.title: Go to JMS namespace element group

td.documentation: The name used to identify the durable subscription. To be applied in case of a topic (pub-sub domain) with subscription durability activated. The durable subscription name needs to be unique within this client's JMS client id. Default is the class name of the specified message listener.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
The version of Hibernate to use when generating.
Allowable values are:
2
3

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
Denotes whether or not subclasses should be mapped into the same .hbm.xml file or in a separate one.
Set this value to subclass when you want to have a mapping file per entity
The default is hierarchy which will render a mapping file per subclass
This information is important for the Spring cartridge because it needs to know which entities require a mapping file and which don't.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to TRUE to enable Hibernate's XML persistence support using dom4J. "hibernateVersion" must be set to "3"

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the HQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the hibernate inheritance strategy (unless overridden on an entity level by the @andromda.hibernate.inheritance tagged value, can be the following possible values:
class - table per hierarchy.
subclass - table per class in hierarchy.
concrete - Table per class.
interface - Root class is defined as an interface and the attributes remapped to the subclasses. This is useful in the concrete case because it has limitations in the associations.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not the hibernate interceptor should be enabled on services.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Hibernate connection pool size.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Strategy for obtaining the JTA TransactionManager

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: The JNDI name of the JTA UserTransaction object

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: The fully qualified class name of the Hibernate TransactionFactory implementation

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to use outer joins.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements (true/false). By default this is off (within Hibernate).

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: JNDI name bound to the SessionFactory.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: SQL dialect of the database being used.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Qualify unqualified tablenames with the given schema/tablespace in generated SQL.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. eg. recommended values between 0 and 3

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. ex: recommended values between 5 and 30

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when the SessionFactory is created. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the SessionFactory is closed explicitely. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Allows you to define new Hibernate query tokens. For example: giving this a value of true=1, false=0 would cause the tokens true and false to be translated to integer literals in the generated SQL.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
Enable/disable hibernate's second level cache features when using Hibernate.
true
false

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the Hibernate cache provider implementation class.

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines Hibernate query cache factory implementation class

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation:
Specify when Hibernate should release JDBC connections. By default, a JDBC connection is held until the session is explicitly closed or disconnected. For an application server JTA datasource, you should use after_statement to aggressively release connections after every JDBC call. For a non-JTA connection, it often makes sense to release the connection at the end of each transaction, by using after_transaction. auto will choose after_statement for the JTA and CMT transaction strategies and after_transaction for the JDBC transaction strategy.
Valid values are:
on_close - default
after_transaction
after_statement
auto

a.title: Go to Hibernate namespace element group

td.documentation: A list of one or more fully qualified java types that should be ignored whenever a type conversion needs to be done. Currently, there is an issue with ValueObjects generated with the Java Axis mappings that causes Spring cartidge to generate DAO "entity to value object" type conversions incorrectly for all date types. By listing those date types here, the Spring cartridge will not attempt to auto-generate conversions for date/time related attributes.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not acegi security framework should be used for role based recurity handling for spring services.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security interception.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision manager.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision voter.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix for all roles defined in the model. This configures the acegiServiceDecisionVoters rolePrefix attribute. As proposed by Acegi for our default voter org.acegisecurity.vote.RoleVoter, the default value is ROLE_. It can be overwritten with an empty string if no prefix is wanted/neccessary at all. Please NOTE that AndroMDA will add this prefix to all role/actor names, which do not already have it defined in the model.

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).

a.title: Go to Acegi Security namespace element group

td.documentation: The bean name of the acegi run as manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to "true" if the cartridge is generating code for a rich client environment.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: A prefix to use for properties stored in configuration files. A typical setting for this is the application ID plus the "." character. Empty by default.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for server side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used (i.e. acegiServiceSecurity is true).

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for client side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used (i.e. acegiServiceSecurity is true).

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean ref factory resource file used for unit testing the server code (i.e. application-test.xml)

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the configuration file for the data source of the server test code (i.e. application-test-dataSource.xml)

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for server side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used and unit tests are being performed.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class to use if a specialized HttpInvokerExecutor is desired on the client side when HttpInvoker is used as the remote service protocol. One common use it to use org.acegisecurity.context.httpinvoker.AuthenticationSimpleHttpInvokerRequestExecutor when remote services are protected with Basic Authentication using Acegi security. Another use is to set this to org.springframework.remoting.httpinvoker.CommonsHttpInvokerRequestExecutor if you want to use Jakarta Commons HttpClient to execute requests.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The class of the authentication manager bean named with the aceciAuthenticationManager namespace property. If defined, an implementation definition will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication Dao Provider used by the server side authentication manager implemented with the acegiAuthenticationManagerImplClass namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The class of the Dao Authentication Provider bean named with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderBeanName namespace property. If defined, an implementation definition will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication Dao used by the default server side authentication implementation generated for rich client projects.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The complete package name and class name of the class that implements user authentication. This property should be set if you want to manage user authentication yourself and you want AndroMDA to generate stub classes to get the process started.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a cache for user information. If defined, it activate user caching in the Dao provider by setting the "userCache" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class used to implement user caching in the Dao provider. If defined, a user cache implementation will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property. If defined, you must also define the acegiUserCacheConfigLocation namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The location of the EhCache configuration file used by the acegiDaoUserCacheImplClass. This name is used as the "configLocation" property in the configuration of the implementation of the acegiDaoUserCacheImplClass namespace property. You should also define the acegiUserCacheName namespace property so it matches the cache name of the cache to use that is defined in the EhCache configuration file. If "default" is used for this property, a "default implementation" will be generated in the server configuration outlet. The file will be named ehcache-server-authentication.xml.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the cache configuration to use for caching user authentication information. This cache configuration should be found in the EhCache configuration file defined with the acegiUserCacheConfigLocation namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a password encoder for user information. If defined, it activates user password encoding in the Dao provider by setting the "passwordEncoder" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the class used to implement user password encoder in the Dao provider. If defined, a password encoder implementation will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

a.title: Go to Rich Client namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a password encoder salt source for user information. If defined, it enhances user password encoding in the Dao provider by setting the "saltSource" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

a.title: Go to Remoting namespace element group

td.documentation:
Determines the type of remoting to be used for Spring services. Can any one of
none
rmi
httpinvoker
burlap
hessian
lingo
Please note that in order to use Lingo remoting, you need to use Spring 2.0.

a.title: Go to Remoting namespace element group

td.documentation: The port the exported services get published on.

a.title: Go to Remoting namespace element group

td.documentation: This port will be used if you export services using Lingo remoting.

a.title: Go to Remoting namespace element group

td.documentation: The context the exported services get published on.

a.title: Go to Remoting namespace element group

td.documentation: The remote server the Spring services get published on.
